item.title: Dominic Cummings allegations: Labour wants minister to face MPs
item.description: Party wants a government minister to face questions in the Commons amid claims by former No 10 aide.

item.title: Social media boycott: Premier League clubs join four-day move to tackle abuse
item.description: Premier League, EFL and WSL clubs join in a four-day boycott of social media platforms in an effort to combat abuse and discrimination.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Battle not over' amid jab campaign for under-50s
item.description: Younger people are being urged to get vaccinated as more than half the population have had one dose.

item.title: Iraq Covid hospital fire: At least 23 dead after 'oxygen tank explodes'
item.description: Flames across several floors lead to scenes of panic at a hospital in the Iraqi capital.

item.title: Oscars 2021: Stars prepare for in-person ceremony
item.description: The 93rd Academy Awards take place on Sunday night, from multiple locations around the world.

item.title: Deep Time study: French volunteers leave cave after 40 days in isolation
item.description: The 40-day experiment in France aimed to test the limits of human adaptability to isolation.

item.title: Biden says Armenian mass killing was genocide
item.description: The statement by the US president drew an immediate rebuke from Turkey, which disputes the term.

item.title: Cisco says computer chip shortage to last six months
item.description: The semiconductor shortage is affecting firms from carmakers to smartphone manufacturers.

item.title: European Super League: Clubs 'cannot leave', says Real Madrid president Florentino Perez
item.description: The 12 clubs that agreed to join a new European Super League have "binding contracts" and "cannot leave", says Real Madrid president Florentino Perez.

item.title: Covid: Man arrested after infecting 22 people in Majorca
item.description: The man allegedly coughed on his colleagues and told them they would get sick, Spanish police said.

item.title: Slieve Donard: Over 100 firefighters continue to tackle Mournes 'major incident'
item.description: Helicopters are used to transport firefighters to fight a large fire in the Mourne Mountains.

item.title: Butetown: Search to find people in photos from Cardiff Docks past
item.description: Historians are asking for help to identify people in photos taken in the city around 100 years ago.

item.title: The Papers: 'Cummings dossier fear' and No 10 'counter-attack'
item.description: The front pages focus on the fallout from allegations by former Downing Street adviser Dominic Cummings.

item.title: Brazil: Environment police battle for Amazon rainforest
item.description: Riots, policy changes and funding cuts have all threatened the mission to protect the Amazon rainforest from deforestation.

item.title: TikTok: 'My nan has helped me get millions of views'
item.description: Lewis Leigh, 19, has attracted 1.2m followers on TikTok - with a little help from his family.

item.title: Oscars 2021: 'I don't mind being the underdog'
item.description: Irish animation studio Cartoon Saloon's latest film Wolfwalkers is up for an Oscar on Sunday night.

item.title: How Armel Zola is helping people to 'stay positive' at home
item.description: The former footballer is teaching dancing in lockdown to young adults with Down's Syndrome.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'fences'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: US Dragon spaceship arrives at International Space Station
item.description: SpaceX's Dragon Endeavour spacecraft has docked with the International Space Station.

item.title: The real-life nomads of Nomadland
item.description: Meet the Americans whose lives on the road inspired the Oscar-nominated film.

item.title: Afghanistan War: How can the West fight terrorism after leaving?
item.description: As Western troops prepare to go, there are concerns over the future of counter-terrorism operations.

item.title: The Voice: Grace Holden tells of opening up about her grief
item.description: Grace Holden found talking about her mum's death hard - until she opened up about it on The Voice.

item.title: Deaths climb as India reels from deadly Covid wave
item.description: Heart-wrenching images from crematoriums across the country capture the true toll of the virus.

item.title: Screen time at 'breaking point' but can tech help?
item.description: There is growing evidence notifications and too much screen time can reduce attention and productivity.

item.title: European Super League: 'A seismic, pivotal week in football - but game not yet over'
item.description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan looks back at a 'seismic and pivotal' launch and crash of the European Super League, and what might happen next.

item.title: Q&A: Armenian genocide dispute
item.description: What was the Armenian "genocide" and why is it still such a sensitive issue?

item.title: It's the Oscars 2021 - but how many people have seen the main films?
item.description: This year's Academy Awards take place on Sunday, with a largely low-key crop of contenders.

item.title: 'Tough' England show winning character but 'plan B' needed for World Cup
item.description: Head coach Simon Middleton hails his England side after they win a bruising encounter against France to claim a third successive Women's Six Nations.

item.title: Usman knocks out Masvidal to retain UFC welterweight title
item.description: Kamaru Usman scores a stunning second-round knockout to finish Jorge Masvidal and retain the undisputed UFC welterweight title.

item.title: 'We learn or we don't play Champions League' - do Liverpool deserve top-four place?
item.description: Manager Jurgen Klopp says Liverpool's performance on Saturday was not that of a team who deserve a place in the Champions League - but can they turn their fortunes around?

item.title: West Ham United 0-1 Chelsea: Timo Werner earns Blues key win in race for top four
item.description: Chelsea take a huge step towards securing a Champions League spot as Timo Werner's first goal since February helps Thomas Tuchel's side beat top four rivals West Ham.

item.title: Match of the Day: Alan Shearer and Micah Richards 'flabbergasted' by Fabian Balbuena's red
item.description: Match of the Day trio Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards describe Fabian Balbuena's red card during West Ham's defeat by Chelsea as "ridiculous" and "embarrassing".

item.title: Women's Six Nations Highlights: England beat France 10-6 to win tournament for third year in a row
item.description: Watch highlights as England beat France 10-6 at the Twickenham Stoop to win the Women's Six Nations for the third year in a row.

item.title: Formula E Valencia E-Prix: 'It's an absolute catastrophe!' Formula E teams miscalculate race distance
item.description: Watch the closing stages of the safety car-dominated Formula E Valencia E-Prix, which saw many drivers fail to finish, after running out of energy.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 45 or over in England are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel through two south London boroughs are being urged to take a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Which countries are on the red list and what are the quarantine rules?
item.description: India has now been added to the UK Government's Covid "red list" of countries.

item.title: India Covid crisis: Did election rallies help spread virus?
item.description: Did campaigning for state elections in India help coronavirus to spread?

item.title: Covid: Restaurants and pubs are reopening, but what are the rules?
item.description: Pubs, cafes and restaurants will reopen in Wales and Scotland on Monday 26 April.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: A nightmare on repeat - India is running out of oxygen again
item.description: Facing a rising wave of coronavirus, and record case numbers, India finds itself battling for breath.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The number of people allowed to meet in Wales is changing - and you can now get a haircut in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 33 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the UK's plans?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Is the Australia-NZ travel bubble the way ahead?
item.description: Australia and New Zealand have quarantine-free travel, but will other countries follow their lead?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: Mouse deer born at Bristol Zoo is the height of a pencil
item.description: The tiny fawn is only 20cm (8ins) tall, and when fully grown will only weigh about 1.5kg (3lb).

item.title: Midsomer Murders: The county that hopes a police show will lure back visitors
item.description: "I thought it would be nice to find the places it was filmed - I used to go out most weekends."

item.title: Rare bug spotted for first time in more than 30 years
item.description: The discovery in the Cairngorms is only the eighth time a cow wheat shieldbug has been recorded in Scotland.

item.title: Crash cyclist Josh Quigley to make Guinness World Record bid
item.description: Josh Quigley is aiming to break Jack Thompson's record of cycling 2,177 miles in a week.

item.title: European Super League: Fans' outcry encouraging, says Sheen
item.description: The Hollywood actor discusses his new Oxford University bursary and football in a lockdown chat.
